snippet: A car bombing opened the Taliban’s latest attack in Kabul, and officials said the attackers took shelter in or near a guesthouse for the Spanish Embassy.
abstract: Afghan officials provide conflicting reports about fate of alleged Taliban attackers who set off large car explosion in Kabul's diplomatic quarter; some say all attackers have been killed while other reports say they are hiding inside guesthouse near Spanish Embassy.

byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and AHMAD SHAKIB
byline.contributor: Khalid Alokozay contributed reporting from Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: A car bombing opened the Taliban’s latest attack in Kabul, and officials said the attackers took shelter in or near a guesthouse for the Spanish Embassy.

headline.main: Bomb Rocks Kabul’s Diplomatic Quarter and Starts a Standoff
headline.print_headline: Bomb Rocks Kabul Enclave for Diplomats
